title: Boy, 12, Arrested in Teen's Fatal Shooting: Garland Police
content:
Shutterstock
A 12-year-old boy has been arrested in connection with the fatal shooting of a teen that was initially considered a possible suicide, police say.
Garland police and paramedics responded to a medical emergency call in the 3900 block of Plymouth Drive at about 6 p.m. Feb. 26.
When they arrived, they found 13-year-old Matthew Cisneros dead from an apparent gunshot wound and a gun on the ground beside him.
Detectives' initial investigation did not confirm whether the death was a suicide or a killing, according to police.
After detectives worked with the Dallas County medical examiner and contacted Cisneros' relatives and friends, officials said they arrested a 12-year-old male in connection with Cisneros' death March 20.
Detectives said they think Cisneros and the 12-year-old were playing with the gun inside Cisneros' home when the youth pulled the trigger — thinking the gun was not loaded.
